page.title: 09River Clun
page.content: We walked from Whitcott Evan weir (depth 1.3m)to Clun Bridge tallying trees. Altogether we walked approx. 3km. The trees we saw were: alder 1500, blackthorn 20, hazel 1, hawthorn 98, sycamore 3, willow 82, oak 3, ash 25. We compiled a list of fauna which we saw ourselves or have been told of by other people, such as farmers. Mammals:water vole, water rat, otter and shrew. Birds: kingfisher, heron, dipper, grey wagtail, pied wagtail and mallard duck. In Clun, the River Clun is spanned by a 14th century bridge. We carried out a traffic survey to see how much this bridge is used.In one hour, at mid-day the bridge was crossed by: 87 motor cars, 21 vans, 8 lorries, 3 cyclists, 11 other vehicles & 60 pedestrians.
